instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2533: What is 820-2533? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V43_G3H: What is PP3V43_G3H? This is a typo of PP3V42_G3H When you see PP3V43_G3H, assume they meant to type PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGOD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGOD? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD When you see ALL_SYS_PWRGOD, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime, no pictures
threads.message:
working on a old [URL="tel:<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>"]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>[/URL] with no pictures, no backlight and no chime.

I don't know history off board but found some a little area with water damage (around <CHIP>U6990</CHIP> replace <CHIP>U6990</CHIP> and the capacitor straight with and cleaned area)

Still no pictures no chime no backlight.

When I remove the ram it is beeping with ram error.

I measured pin 6 on spi rom and get 0V
When I press start on the machine pin 6 gose from 0V till around 1,5V then back to 0V.

When measuring <SIGNAL>PP3V43_G3H</SIGNAL> to ground I getting 3.05kOhm

When I try too measure <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGOD</SIGNAL> the machine shouting off..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime, no pictures
threads.message: 3.05K on 3V42 is way too low. Dead MCP is the usual problem.
